text: Sergio Akieme Rodríguez (born 16 December 1997) is a Spanish professional footballer who plays as a left-back for UD Almería, on loan from FC Barcelona. He also holds Equatoguinean citizenship. ==Club career== Akieme was born in Madrid through Equatoguinean parents – his father was born in Bata while his mother was born in Malabo. He joined Rayo Vallecano's youth setup in August 2013 at the age of 15, from Getafe CF. Akieme made his senior debut with the reserves on 30 August 2015, starting in a 1–1 Tercera División away draw against CDA Navalcarnero. On 30 December he was included in Paco Jémez's first team call up for a La Liga match against Atlético Madrid, but remained an unused substitute in the 0–2 home loss the following day. Akieme made his professional debut on 6 September 2016, starting in a 2–0 Copa del Rey away win against UD Almería. He made his Segunda División debut the following 9 June, coming on as a second-half substitute for Lass Bangoura in a 2–1 away win against Sevilla Atlético. On 2 September 2019, Akieme signed a two-year deal with FC Barcelona, being initially assigned to the reserves in Segunda División B. Akieme has made a bright start to his career with Barcelona B, registering 4 assists in 23 games from left back. On the 22 February he was named in the squad to play against Eibar, due to an injury of first choice left back Jordi Alba. On 19 September 2020, Akieme joined UD Almería in the second division on a year-long loan with a mandatory buy option if he plays 22 games. ==Career statistics== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|League !rowspan="2"|Season !colspan="2"|League !colspan="2"|Domestic Cup !colspan="2"|Europe !colspan="2"|Other !colspan="2"|Total |- !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals |- |rowspan=6|Rayo Vallecano |La Liga |2015–16 ||0||0||0||0||colspan=4|—||0||0 |- |rowspan="2"|Segunda División |2016–17 ||1||0||1||0||colspan=4|—||2||0 |- |2017–18 ||3||0||1||0||colspan=4|—||4||0 |- |La Liga |2018–19 ||2||0||2||0||colspan=4|—||4||0 |- |Segunda División |2019–20 ||3||0||0||0||colspan=4|—||3||0 |- !colspan="2"|Total !9!!0!!4!!0!!colspan=4|—!!13!!0 |- |Barcelona B |Segunda División B |2019–20 ||24||0||0||0|| colspan="2" |— |3Three appearances in Segunda División B play- offs |0||27||0 |- |Almería (loan) |Segunda División |2020–21 ||3||1||0||0||colspan=2|—||0||0||3||1 |- !colspan="3"|Career total !36!!1!!4!!0!!0!!0!!3!!0!!43!!1 |} ==Honours== ;Rayo Vallecano *Segunda División: 2017–18 ==References== ==External links== * Category:1997 births Category:Living people Category:Sportspeople from Madrid Category:Citizens of Equatorial Guinea through descent Category:Spanish people of Equatoguinean descent Category:Spanish footballers Category:Madrilenian footballers Category:Equatoguinean footballers Category:Association football fullbacks Category:La Liga players Category:Segunda División players Category:Segunda División B players Category:Tercera División players Category:Rayo Vallecano B players Category:Rayo Vallecano players Category:FC Barcelona B players Category:UD Almería players Category:Spain youth international footballers
